questions.question_text: A project team is working on a sensitive project that requires the use of an isolated email system for all project communications. Outside vendors are frustrated by the lack of response to emails sent to the corporate email addresses of the project team. Which of the following is the BEST way for the project team to communicate with outside vendors?

discussion.content: Why will some use a public email system for external communication regarding a sensitive project? Why not ask the Vendor to sign NDA and invite them to use the internal system?

comments.content: Yes I would invite them in if it is so sensitive

choices.C: Request the vendors use a courier to deliver project documents.
choices.B: Use a public email system for external communication.
choices.A: Invite the vendors to utilize the isolated email system.
choices.D: Provide the vendors with a phone roster to set up regular meetings.

questions.question_text:
A project has fallen behind schedule. Upon investigation, the project manager determines that team members have implemented requirements relayed via impromptu hallway meetings with the client.
Which of the following should the project manager do to resolve this issue?

choices.D: Inform the stakeholders of the issue.

comments.content: D is the right answer. It is about resolving this issue in future.
No need for change control management bcos the change has already been implemented.
Agreed, the question specifies how to resolve. Simply contacting the stakeholder will keep things transparent but it wouldn't resolve anything

discussion.content:
Implementing Change Control Management will prevent the Project Team from signing off on these "hallway ideas". As the PM, you can inform Stakeholders all you want, but you're in charge of the Project Teams and therefore need to resolve this through proper procedures with them. You can't expect Stakeholders to stop asking for things, whether or not they've been informed that's not the proper procedure. You can prevent your own teams from accepting this work, by enacting Change Control "Management".

I do think it would be beneficial to inform Stakeholders of the issue, to try to prevent these requests in the future, but CompTIA is definitely looking for the "book" answer here. I don't understand peoples arguments below saying "the damage is done" and how informing stakeholders resolves this damage... you don't control the stakeholders, you manage your teams.
Damage has been done, need to tell the parents about it and come up with a damage control plan, not change control.

Selected Answer: C
Should be C
I believe C due to the actual steps to "resolve " the issue with unauthorized changes requiring implementing change control management to fix the issue.

"Which of the following should the project manager do to resolve this issue?"
The issue is changes being implemented outside of the CCB, you need to inform stakeholders so everyone can follow procedure.
Answer is C. Implement change control management. Project baselines cannot be modified. Schedule and scope changes should be initiated through change control.

comments.content: The ship already sailed, a promise was made to the client. So you're dealing with an existing change already promised. Change management would only address proposed items, not items already promised.
